clues.text: Number of Jay-Z' title "Problems", or "Bottles Of Beer On The Wall"
The second line in a haiku typically has this many syllables
Oh, craps! On the first dice roll I threw boxcars, this number
It's the atomic number of iridium; it also used to be a famous TV address on the Sunset Strip
In 1929 Congress limited the House of Representatives to this many members

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each response here will be one of the cardinal or theological Virtues.)

clues.text: It's paired with liberty in the Pledge of Allegiance
We assume that Bill Clinton was born with it; we know he was born in it
You "gotta have" this virtue; at least according to George Michael
This virtue is also a name of a Rhode Island island & a "Dear" Beatles song character
It was the "T" in the 19th century's WCTU
Cleopatra's cobra plus a command to stop gives us this road surface
To ask for spare change plus one ninth of a baseball game gives us this starting place
One piece of butter plus public group violence gives us this nation lover
A Catholic religious service plus a standard unit of area gives us this wanton slaughter
A shark appendage plus a type of beer gives us this musical conclusion
A box for fishing gear, or a defensive football play
Last name of the singer of "What A Wonderful World" in '67 & the man who got a Moon's-eye view of it in '69
The organ that weighs around 3 pounds in an adult, or Pinky's cartoon pal voiced by Maurice LaMarche
A vice president under Thomas Jefferson, or the funky leader of Parliament Funkadelic
Last name of a Watergate burglar, or a nickname of Robert Dole's wife, who has lived at the Watergate

rounds.category: IF AT FIRST YOU DON'T SECEDE...

clues.text: "We seceded where others failed" is the motto of the Conch Republic, formed for 1 minute by these Florida islands
It was the first U.S. state to secede, leading to the Civil War
In 1965 this island city-state peacefully seceded from Malaysia
In 2011 the south part of this northeast African nation became independent
This nation has fought several battles over territory with Ethiopia since seceding from it in 1993

rounds.comments: (Ken: ...with the prefix "tri" in each correct response.)

clues.text: It straightens the arm at the elbow
Swimming, cycling & running all in one event
The period that lasted from about 250 million to 200 million years ago
From the Latin for "platform for magistrates", it's a court of justice
A group of 3 men collectively responsible for the administration of ancient Rome
Indonesia's the place to see this ape whose name comes from Malay for "person of the forest"
Go deep (though not 20,000 leagues) to find Architeuthis dux, this rarely seen cephalopod
The Amur tiger, aka this tiger, ranges from southeastern Russia to northern China
Formosan rock macaques are only found in Japan & in the mountains & forests of this Asian island
We have good hope you can tell us this alternate name for the African buffalo (it lives in Africa, by the way)
Rocky Balboa has begun training Adonis Johnson; will Adonis have the eye of the tiger? That's up next in sports
A crime novelist, dead in his mansion under mysterious circumstances. Benoit Blanc, on the case. Eyewitness News starts now
2 musicians dressed like undertakers led police on a wild chase through Chicago. Their car, & many others, did not survive the trip
A young man from Mumbai won big on a game show tonight; the winning final answer? Aramis, from "The Three Musketeers"!
An APB is out for a man who escaped a southern chain gang; authorities noted the man's amazing blue eyes & "failure to communicate"

rounds.category: I HAVE A PREPOSITION FOR YOU

clues.text: These 2 prepositions are absolutely critical in a crossword puzzle
As a noun, it's your rear; as a preposition, it means toward the rear
It means against, whether in a legal action or a sports contest
Meaning "more distant than", it also follows "the great" to denote the afterlife
You "go" this "to get" this to make a social situation go smoothly
The Imperial Hotel he designed in Tokyo survived quakes & wars but was demolished in 1968
He penned 1981's "God Emperor of Dune"
Frank Ocean's first label album was "Channel" this color, which debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard charts
He won 3 Oscars as a director, including one for "It Happened One Night"
This composer got a Pulitzer for "How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying"
In addition to its famous wine, Madeira farmers grow a dwarf species of this tropical fruit of the genus Musa
The Atlantic Ocean archipelago of Madeira is an autonomous region  of this nation
In the 1470s this explorer worked & lived in Madeira & married Felipa, the daughter of one of its governors
Madeira wine is fortified with this spirit to raise the alcohol content to about 20%
The British temporarily occupied Madeira during the wars named for this man
The Judiciary Act of 1789 created this Cabinet job
In 1981 the Maritime Administration was transferred from Commerce to this Cabinet department
The first Cabinet secretary in the line of presidential succession
The secretary of this newest Cabinet department is last in the order of presidential succession, behind Veterans Affairs
At the time of its establishment in 1849, this Cabinet department was also known as the Home Department

rounds.text: FDR gets credit for implementing this as a concept in the U.S. & the metaphor was used by FDR Jr., running for office in 1966
